column1: Bab El Oued is a neighbourhood in Algiers
column3: along the coast north of the city centre. As of 2008
column4: the population of the commune of Bab El Oued was 64

column1: During the existence of French Algeria
column2: Bab El Oued was established as the main neighbourhood of poor pied-noirs
column3: including many poor fishermen. Towards the end of the Algerian War of Independence
column4: the neighbourhood became the stronghold of the Organisation armée secrète
column5: until OAS attacks on the French Army led them to assault and purge the neighbourhood
column6: during the siege of Bab el Oued on March 1962. Soon after
column8: and the pied noir population fled the country. The neighbourhood was rapidly occupied by Muslim Algerians.

column1: The neighbourhood again gained notoriety during the leadup to the Algerian Civil War (which broke out in 1991) as a stronghold of the Islamic Salvation Front
column2: or FIS. Its population in 1998 was 102

column1: Abd al-Rahman al-Tha'alibi is buried here
